Hey there, recently i noticed something interesting. If you rub your mobile phone's charger's metal part of micro usb or type c with your ear pinna while plugged in with wall outlet, you can hear a buzzing sound like arc. I don't know the real reason. do anyone know it?
i discovered it as i always test a third party charger before plugging it to my phone to check if there is any high leakage current. the way of doing is by touching it to my ear. if i get zapped myself, then i consider the charger is not good for my phone.

well yes you can run a diesel engine without a battery but not "electricity", that is what my comment was intended to say, you still need that resource to run the engine, however how are you going to start the engine.
Bottom line is yes you can run it without a battery (after starting) but no you still need "electricity" to "RUN" the engine

Adam, I don't own diesel engine, mostly trucks are only diesel these days. Gas engine cannot run without spark plugs, diesel engine has no spark plugs. Compression ignites the fuel. They have alternator and battery for electronic devices, such as lights, wipers, etc. If you give up on these features, you can essentially run a diesel car without electricity.
dude, the injection system of a diesel engine needs electricity, if you think it does not need electricity then try running your engine without a battery or alternator.
